relation: Great for these types of students
There are always security driving through parking lots and walking through campus.
I myself never joined clubs but there are a few clubs and sport teams offered.
Students who are looking to transfer onto a 4 year college. I would suggest making sure classes you're taking are transferable to whatever college you might be looking into.

The school does offer some sports and clubs you can join, but most of all what LCC offers is friends who are always close to you. Making plans to meat on campus just to hang with friends or play a little basketball is so easily done with LCC.
The prices are high for a community college without meal plan options. The food is generally very good with options for people with different tastes.
The teachers are fantastic and very willing to help out. They enjoy questions that we answer and also teach at other colleges and universities so they can help when looking into transferring.

Take advantage of everything offered. There is a gym with many different types of equipment along with computer labs and the library that offers free printing. Anything you can accomplish on campus take advantage of it.

Compared to other colleges and universities in my area, that's pocket change. At LCCC, I'm getting a good education, and saving a lot of money at the same time.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Brittany from Wilkes - Barre, PA 06/29/2012 Reviewer is A current student here. 1 out of 1 people found this review useful. 3 of 25 Categories Comments What to do for fun There is the fitness room, which has a game room as well. There are plenty of sports or other clubs and activities! Food and Dining I have never gotten food at Luzerne, it is way too expensive!! People do say it tastes alright though. Dorm Life Luzerne does not have dorms, however, many people live around the campus or commute! I am a commuter, and I think it is easier for me to maintain my schedule with not being in a dorm. Academic Rigor Make sure that you always have what you need for class! Tips for prospective students
